title: Well-founded relation
summary: In mathematics, a binary relation R is called well-founded (or wellfounded or foundational[1]) on a class X if every non-empty subset S ⊆ X has a minimal element with respect to R, that is, an element m ∈ S not related by s R m (for instance, "s is not smaller than m") for any s ∈ S. In other words, a relation is well founded if
